private_information: You specialize in transforming informal action descriptions into precise operator schemas with clear preconditions and effects.
Normalize vocabulary to a canonical predicate set: hand(x), cats(x), sneeze(x), spring(x), texture(x), stupendous(x), collect(x,y), next(x,y), vase(x,y).
Ensure actions paltry, sip, clip, wretched, memory, tightfisted map exactly to these predicates and preserve argument ordering (object_0, object_1, object_2, object_3 when present).
domain_modeler.goal: Deliver a clean, unambiguous, canonical action model and object universe for the orchestrator.

private_information: You specialize in extracting and validating initial states, goals, and any provided reference plans for test scenarios.
There are two independent scenarios derived from the human statements. Keep them separate and consistent with the canonical predicates.
scenario_curator.goal: Summarize both scenarios with object sets, initial facts, goals, and any provided reference plan traces without producing PDDL.

private_information: Coordinate the upstream analyses to synthesize the final planning artifacts.
Target the FastDownwards solver with STRIPS-compatible PDDL (use :strips and avoid negative preconditions; use delete lists for negative effects).
Emit exactly one PDDL domain and two PDDL problems (one per scenario), clearly delimited.
orchestrator.goal: Produce a correct PDDL domain and two problems that capture the given actions and both scenarios, suitable for FastDownwards.

public_information: Action schema paltry(o0 o1 o2): pre hand(o0) and cats(o1) and texture(o2) and vase(o0 o1) and next(o1 o2); add next(o0 o2); del vase(o0 o1).
Action schema sip(o0 o1 o2): pre hand(o0) and cats(o1) and texture(o2) and next(o0 o2) and next(o1 o2); add vase(o0 o1); del next(o0 o2).
Action schema clip(o0 o1 o2): pre hand(o0) and sneeze(o1) and texture(o2) and next(o1 o2) and next(o0 o2); add vase(o0 o1); del next(o0 o2).
Action schema wretched(o0 o1 o2 o3): pre sneeze(o0) and texture(o1) and texture(o2) and stupendous(o3) and next(o0 o1) and collect(o1 o3) and collect(o2 o3); add next(o0 o2); del next(o0 o1).
Action schema memory(o0 o1 o2): pre cats(o0) and spring(o1) and spring(o2) and next(o0 o1); add next(o0 o2); del next(o0 o1).
Action schema tightfisted(o0 o1 o2): pre hand(o0) and sneeze(o1) and texture(o2) and next(o1 o2) and vase(o0 o1); add next(o0 o2); del vase(o0 o1).

Scenario 1 initial facts: cats object_0; cats object_1; collect object_6 object_2; collect object_7 object_2; collect object_8 object_3; collect object_9 object_3; hand object_10; next object_0 object_8; next object_1 object_6; next object_10 object_9; next object_4 object_6; next object_5 object_9; sneeze object_4; sneeze object_5; spring object_6; spring object_8; stupendous object_2; stupendous object_3; texture object_6; texture object_7; texture object_8; texture object_9.

Scenario 1 reference plan: clip object_10 object_5 object_9; wretched object_5 object_9 object_8 object_3; tightfisted object_10 object_5 object_8; sip object_10 object_0 object_8; memory object_0 object_8 object_6; paltry object_10 object_0 object_6.

Scenario 2 initial facts: cats object_0; collect object_5 object_1; collect object_6 object_1; collect object_7 object_2; collect object_8 object_2; hand object_10; hand object_9; next object_0 object_7; next object_10 object_5; next object_3 object_5; next object_4 object_8; next object_9 object_8; sneeze object_3; sneeze object_4; spring object_5; spring object_7; stupendous object_1; stupendous object_2; texture object_5; texture object_6; texture object_7; texture object_8.
Scenario 2 goals: next object_10 object_5 and next object_9 object_7.
Objects present across both scenarios: object_0 through object_10.
Predicates used: hand, cats, sneeze, spring, texture, stupendous, collect (x,y), next (x,y), vase (x,y).
All actions have fixed arity and use ordered arguments matching the human description.

analyze_actions.system_prompt: You are an expert at normalizing informal action descriptions into canonical operator schemas with explicit preconditions and effects and a complete object universe. Do not produce PDDL; instead, return a concise structured synopsis the orchestrator can consume.
analyze_actions.prompt: Your name is domain_modeler. Using the public information {environment->public_information} and your private knowledge {agents->domain_modeler->private_information}, provide: 1) the canonical set of predicates with arities, 2) the object universe, 3) each action's parameters and its add and delete lists exactly as described (paltry, sip, clip, wretched, memory, tightfisted), 4) any invariants helpful for planning such as which predicates are static. Keep everything consistent and unambiguous. Do not emit PDDL.

scenario_summaries.system_prompt: You are an expert at curating scenario data for planners. Do not produce PDDL; produce clean structured scenario summaries.
scenario_summaries.prompt: Your name is scenario_curator. From the public information {environment->public_information}, extract two scenario summaries: for each, list the objects referenced, the full initial fact set, the goal condition set, and any given reference plan trace (only for scenario 1). Validate that all facts use the canonical predicates and object names. Do not emit PDDL.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert PDDL engineer. Using the upstream analyses, synthesize planning artifacts for the FastDownwards solver. Emit one PDDL domain and two PDDL problem files. Use STRIPS-compatible PDDL with :strips requirement, delete lists for negative effects, and no negative preconditions. Keep action names and predicate names exactly as canonicalized. Delimit outputs with <domain></domain> and one <problem id="s1"></problem> and one <problem id="s2"></problem>. Ensure both problems reference the same domain name and enumerate all needed objects.
pddl.prompt: Integrate the action model {action_model} with the scenario data {scenarios} to produce: a PDDL domain named ObfuscatedDeceptiveLogistics7Domain with predicates hand, cats, sneeze, spring, texture, stupendous, collect, next, vase and actions paltry, sip, clip, wretched, memory, tightfisted; and two problem files, one for Scenario 1 targeting goal next(object_10 object_6) and another for Scenario 2 targeting goals next(object_10 object_5) and next(object_9 object_7). Use objects object_0 through object_10. Output exactly one <domain> block and two <problem> blocks as specified.
